I would like to see the Java Minecraft Main Menu offer the ability to switch versions without reloading the entire game - and ability to choose Bedrock or Java from one client. I dont want to have to "quit game" to change versions or to play bedrock. There should at least be a quit to main menu ability at the least.

Yes theres a way,

Your on Java Edition right:

So,

1. first create your world

2.go back to your menu game

3. selct your world but dont play it

4.click re-create your world

5.go to advanced options

6. click the seed box Text

7.then Ctrl+a (Select all) and Ctrl+c (Copy)
That's been in game already my friend.
If you go into settings then touch there is a slider labeled sensitivity.  I don't want to touch it because I like it great as it is, but you might want to play around with it.

I hope anyone who reads this post will consider giving it a vote! Having this post properly considered by Mojang could really create a snowball effect where more languages, not just Gujarati, are properly implemented into the game.

I recognize that many resource packs offer support for various languages, but I feel that is an unnecessary barrier to language accessibility, which can be addressed by Mojang.

This is a good idea, but maybe they should also add the whole player inventory on the sides, i ALWAYS hev problems where i find armor and need to put it on but i dont have space so i have to go in and out

My only complaint so far is that the user interface on consoles could use a serious improvement. Things are pretty hard to find when searching in creative mode and I often get confused when I am trying to craft something in survival !

I would like the new controller crafting to be reverted back to the way is was before the nether update as I find it annoying when I have my inventory layed out the way I prefer and when I craft a item it moves the items I'm using to craft into the hotbar or to a different position in my inventory. I understand why the feature could be useful to some but I think to more people who play with a well organised inventory/hotbar it can just be annoying.
My xbox 1 controller has been glitching in minecraft lately by moving me when I am not doing anything and in the inventory/crafting menu, I am having trouble moving around in it.
We must have ps4 controller tool tips on mobile

I would like to suggest this feature that was in the legacy versions of Minecraft its the quick snap inside the inventory this would make everything feel fast to move items  wherever around your player inventory .

Could you also fix this issue with the inventory where you try and quickly swap an item the previous item won't be on your cusser and it will drop out of your inventory this is a super annoying issue plaugeing the controller users on Minecraft Bedrock

The select recipe I great, but it is annoying that if you have the materials that the recipe requires It crafts the item I think it'd be great if X just show the recipe and A button crafts it

The X to select can be used with villagers, press X select a specific trade and Press A to trade it 

Edit: 

When you select a recipe and then leave the crafting table or craft the item, all the materials go to another inventory slot, I think it would be much more comfortable if they returned to the same spot they were at first place
Controller sensitivity is a lot slower on controller compared to keyboard and mouse

Console controllers should use the left trigger to control left hand and the right trigger to control the right hand just like Java but backwards. Java uses left clicker for the right hand and the right clicker for the left hand. This would allow us to use shields with the left trigger instead of having to crouch to block.  Also this would make it possible for dual wielding. And before anyone says it just make this a feature for private worlds and private realms cause i know phones cant have dual wielding but one version shouldn't hold the rest of Bedrock down.

When I use a controller on an android phone and I try to type something (I have SwiftKey) I glitches out and only shows like a little bit of the keyboard. Meaning I can't type while using a controller.
Its nice that you added that and fixes many problems.
Add split-screen to windows 10 when connecting 2 or more controller.

Regarding the crafting recipe being automatically selected during crafting in the new beta of 1.16.2:
A full inventory will cause items to be dropped on the ground whenever something is crafted. It's very annoying and makes it very finicky and clunky to craft multiple of the same item with a full inventory.
I keep trying to change my A and B controllers but it just doesn't budge. It's like the button to swap the 2 is just there for decoration. I press it and it does nothing.

stuff I would like to change as a controller player...

================

a better crafting UI section to make it a lot faster to craft stuff and clean

new Creative UI on controller to make it more clean and easier to find blocks.
Please add an option to use the Legacy Console UI and have it be enabled by default on consoles, it sucks having to use a UI made for keyboard and mouse on a console with a controller.

The update made a change I would like to see reverted. Before this change you could use square and triangle (or X and Y) to open up your crafting and inventory respectively, and the game would remember for which button to have the recipe tab open. However, after the update, the game no longer tracks this, which ultimately renders the two different buttons useless. Now you have to use either square or triangle (X & Y) to open up your inventory, and then use the bumpers to open and close the tab. I know this is a minor inconvenience, but it is a weird decision because it is counter intuitive. In short, we used to have 2 different functions for 2 different buttons, whereas now we have 2 buttons which are basically the same. Please revert this!
I honestly wish there would be an option to switch the crafting in minecraft to be like the xbox one edition it is much more controller friendly.
JAGBITE you can change what the button does so there's no reason to do so and blocking would be anyway possible cause legacy console edition had sword blocking via left trigger.

I use controller and I find that the cursor in the creative menu still feels very clunky and finicky, I honestly think we should have the option to have the legacy crafting menu and maybe the creative menu as well, it was perfect for controllers and it is very hard to think that the current menus can get to the point of comfort those offered.

Not sure if this is a suggestion for Bedrock or Java, but the Bedrock edition already has a seed picker, with a few select seeds you can choose from that have different starting biomes. Of course nothing like this exists on Java, and bringing that over would be a nice idea.
I wouldn't like that for survival, but it would be super useful for creative if I wanted to see a new biome if one came out.

How about just make different updates part of the world generation settings. This would satisfy all of the complaints that minecraft is getting to complicated. Bug fixes (except ones that remove features of past updates, like old slime block flying machines) should be included in all world types.

I love this idea, especially since we've passed the 10-year anniversary of the game and a little throwback would be nice. The Beta 1.8 Adventure Update, to me, made the worlds boring and largely ununique, so I know that I would frequently play on a world generated like the ones I used to play on back in 2010-2011.

 

Though, I do think it would be neat if they could implement the Farlands as the world border instead of the barrier blocks, just as a nice callback.

This would be so nice. I love the pre1.8 biomes and I really want to see them modernize it. I don't always want mountains in the dull green biome, I want wooded cliffs in the lush green rainforest again. Please bring it back.
Miss the old terrain and I think that this would be a great way of letting players who missed out experience it as well as letting us veterans relive the glory days.

There are mods that do this, and up until they removed custom worlds (which I'm kind of annoyed they havn't gotten around to re adding them yet, it's been years) you could replicate the old terrain

 

It's safe to say that this is something people want, and I see no reason not to

It would be nice if it would have all the new biomes and structures from later versions, but with the wacky generation of the Beta days.
The mod Beta+ is very good at doing that.
Would absolutely love old terrain generation into modern minecraft, especially the beta 1.7.3 terrain generation.

I definitely agree with this. It‚Äôs cool how Minecraft is one of few games that you can actually play up to four players split-screen whilst online with more players. However, the Chatlog keyboard input on both Nintendo Switch and Xbox One is not ‚Äúsplit-screen friendly‚Äù and it is kinda difficult to communicate with online friends while playing split-screen. My idea is to have a mini-on-screen keyboard in each split-screen player‚Äôs screen.

We are pretty sure, when we first got ps4 and Minecraft,(fall 2019) that the on-screen keyboard only displayed on individual screens. We came from Minecraft on wiiu and I remember we were all saying "yay it's actually usable now". I don't know if it changes from an update or we all are remembering wrong but it wasn't very long before the keyboard starting blocking the whole screen. My family rarely uses signs or anything else that brings up the OSK because it gets everyone else killed. I feel like they consider 4 player split screen to be too niche to really worry about. It's the absolute best way to play even considering it's various issues.
My gosh that is the worst user experience. How can you have split screen gaming available that requires keyboard for searching for items or chat and have keyboard pop up and stop both players' games.
This is terrible, still an issue April 2023...
I suggest a general data pack directory on the client like the resourcepacks folder and copying over to each world on world creation.
I LOVE this idea, if this were in the game, I'd never have to use a stupid generator again!

What I don't understand is how an iPad can have a render distance of 32 chunks, whereas an XBOX con only have 14.
its so sad with only 14 chunks, I get that it might be laggy on 20+ chunks, but i would rather have a lower fps than not being able to see whats around my builds

I think a maximum of 40 chunks would be nice on Xbox one. I prefer to play around 24 to 32 and the Xbox definitely used to go that high. I used to play on Xbox 360 and it was capable of 24 chunks. Im pretty sure I remember it going up to 40 but had a warning if you went over 24. I have builds in my world where I can't see the other side of it when I'm on one end. They aren't even that big of builds but 16 chunks is wayyyy too small. I'd even take it if you just put the game on cloud and let me increase render distance that way.
Yes, this would be very helpful, as there is already features like this such as all of the states the block you are looking at is in (ex. Growth stages, infested, waterlogged,...)
